class.name: Phaser.TilemapLayer

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Game reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: tilemap
parameters.help: The tilemap to which this layer belongs.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The layer index within the map that this TilemapLayer represents.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: Width of the renderable area of the layer.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: Height of the renderable area of the layer.

class.help: A Tilemap Layer is a set of map data combined with a Tileset in order to render that data to the game.

public.name: getRayCastTiles
public.help: Gets all tiles that intersect with the given line.

parameters.name: line
parameters.help: The line used to determine which tiles to return.

parameters.name: stepRate
parameters.help: How many steps through the ray will we check? If undefined or null it uses TilemapLayer.rayStepRate.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true only return tiles that collide on one or more faces.

parameters.name: interestingFace
parameters.help: If true only return tiles that have interesting faces.

public.name: getTileX
public.help: Convert a pixel value to a tile coordinate.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the point in target tile.

public.name: getTileXY

returns.help: A Point object with its x and y properties set.

public.help: Convert a pixel value to a tile coordinate.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the point in target tile.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the point in target tile.

parameters.name: point
parameters.help: The Point object to set the x and y values on.

public.name: getTileY
public.help: Convert a pixel value to a tile coordinate.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the point in target tile.

public.name: getTiles
public.help: Get all tiles that exist within the given area, defined by the top-left corner, width and height. Values given are in pixels, not tiles.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left corner.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left corner.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: Width of the area to get.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: Height of the area to get.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true only return tiles that collide on one or more faces.

parameters.name: interestingFace
parameters.help: If true only return tiles that have interesting faces.

public.name: postUpdate
public.help: Automatically called by World.postUpdate. Handles cache updates.

public.name: render
public.help: Renders the tiles to the layer canvas and pushes to the display.

public.name: renderDebug
public.help: Renders a collision debug overlay on-top of the canvas. Called automatically by render when debug = true.

public.name: resizeWorld
public.help: Sets the world size to match the size of this layer.

public.name: updateMax
public.help: Internal function to update maximum values.

private.name: _fixX
private.help: Take an x coordinate that doesn't account for scrollFactorX and 'fix' it\ninto a scrolled local space. Used primarily internally

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: x coordinate in camera space

private.name: _fixY
private.help: Take a y coordinate that doesn't account for scrollFactorY and 'fix' it\ninto a scrolled local space. Used primarily internally

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: y coordinate in camera space

private.name: _unfixX
private.help: Take an x coordinate that _does_ account for scrollFactorX and 'unfix' it\nback to camera space. Used primarily internally

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: x coordinate in scrollFactor-adjusted dimensions

private.name: _unfixY
private.help: Take a y coordinate that _does_ account for scrollFactorY and 'unfix' it\nback to camera space. Used primarily internally

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: y coordinate in scrollFactor-adjusted dimensions

public.name: baseTexture
public.inlineHelp: Required Pixi var.

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixed to the camera then use this Point to specify how far away from the Camera x/y it's rendered.

public.name: canvas
public.inlineHelp: The canvas to which this TilemapLayer draws.

public.name: collisionHeight
public.inlineHelp: The height of the collision tiles.

public.name: collisionWidth
public.inlineHelp: The width of the collision tiles.

public.name: context
public.inlineHelp: The 2d context of the canvas.

public.name: debug
public.inlineHelp: If set to true the collideable tile edges path will be rendered. Only works when game is running in Phaser.CANVAS mode.

public.name: debugAlpha
public.inlineHelp: If debug is true then the tileset is rendered with this alpha level, to make the tile edges clearer.

public.name: debugCallbackColor
public.inlineHelp: If debug is true this is the color used to outline the edges of tiles that have collision callbacks. Provide in hex or rgb/rgba string format.

public.name: debugColor
public.inlineHelp: If debug is true this is the color used to outline the edges of collidable tiles. Provide in hex or rgb/rgba string format.

public.name: debugFill
public.inlineHelp: If true the debug tiles are filled with debugFillColor AND stroked around.

public.name: debugFillColor
public.inlineHelp: If debugFill is true this is the color used to fill the tiles. Provide in hex or rgb/rgba string format.

public.name: dirty
public.inlineHelp: Flag controlling when to re-render the layer.

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.help: An object that is fixed to the camera ignores the position of any ancestors in the display list and uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera.
public.inlineHelp: Fixes this object to the Camera.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: index
public.inlineHelp: The index of this layer within the Tilemap.

public.name: layer
public.inlineHelp: The layer object within the Tilemap that this layer represents.

public.name: map
public.inlineHelp: The Tilemap to which this layer is bound.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: The name of the layer.

public.name: rayStepRate
public.inlineHelp: When ray-casting against tiles this is the number of steps it will jump. For larger tile sizes you can increase this to improve performance.

public.name: scrollFactorX
public.help: horizontally, relative to the camera (e.g. scrollFactorX of 0.5 scrolls\nhalf as quickly as the 'normal' camera-locked layers do)
public.inlineHelp: speed at which this layer scrolls

public.name: scrollFactorY
public.help: vertically, relative to the camera (e.g. scrollFactorY of 0.5 scrolls\nhalf as quickly as the 'normal' camera-locked layers do)
public.inlineHelp: speed at which this layer scrolls

public.name: scrollX
public.inlineHelp: Scrolls the map horizontally or returns the current x position.

public.name: scrollY
public.inlineHelp: Scrolls the map vertically or returns the current y position.

public.name: texture
public.inlineHelp: Required Pixi var.

public.name: textureFrame
public.inlineHelp: Dimensions of the renderable area.

public.name: tileColor
public.inlineHelp: If no tileset is given the tiles will be rendered as rectangles in this color. Provide in hex or rgb/rgba string format.

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The const type of this object.

public.name: wrap
public.inlineHelp: Flag controlling if the layer tiles wrap at the edges. Only works if the World size matches the Map size.

private.name: _mc
private.inlineHelp: Local map data and calculation cache.

private.name: _results
private.inlineHelp: Local render loop var to help avoid gc spikes.
